org.apache.edgent.samples.utils.sensor

Class SimpleSimulatedSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.edgent.samples.utils.sensor.SimpleSimulatedSensor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Supplier<java.lang.Double>

    public class SimpleSimulatedSensor
extends java.lang.Object
implements Supplier<java.lang.Double>
    A simple simulated sensor.

    The sensor starts off with an initial value. Each call to get() changes the current value by a random amount between plus/minus deltaFactor. The new current value is limited to a range and then rounded to 1 fractional digit. See setNumberFractionalDigits(int).

    Sample use: 

    
 Topology t = ...;
 // a miles-per-gallon sensor
 SimpleSimulatedSensor avgMpgSensor = new SimpleSimulatedSensor(10.5, 0.4,
                                          Ranges<Double>.closed(7.0,14.0));
 TStream<Double> avgMpg = t.poll(avgMpgSensor, 1, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
 
 // an integer valued sensor
 SimpleSimulatedSensor doubleSensor = new SimpleSimulatedSensor();
 TStream<Integer> intSensor = t.poll(() -> doubleSensor.get().intValue(),
                                          1, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
    See Also:

      • SimpleSimulatedSensor

        public SimpleSimulatedSensor()
        Create a sensor.

        Same as SimpleSimulatedSensor(0.0, 1.0, null);

      • SimpleSimulatedSensor

        public SimpleSimulatedSensor(double initialValue)
        Create a sensor.

        Same as SimpleSimulatedSensor(initialValue, 1.0, null);

        Parameters:
        initialValue - the initial value

      • SimpleSimulatedSensor

        public SimpleSimulatedSensor(double initialValue,
                             double deltaFactor)
        Create a sensor.

        Same as SimpleSimulatedSensor(initialValue, deltaFactor, null);

        Parameters:
        initialValue - the initial value.
        deltaFactor - maximum plus/minus change on each get(). e.g., 1.0 to limit change to +/- 1.0. Must be > 0.0

      • SimpleSimulatedSensor

        public SimpleSimulatedSensor(double initialValue,
                             double deltaFactor,
                             Range<java.lang.Double> range)
        Create a sensor.
        Parameters:
        initialValue - the initial value. Must be within range.
        deltaFactor - maximum plus/minus change on each get(). e.g., 1.0 to limit change to +/- 1.0. Must be > 0.0
        range - maximum sensor value range. Unlimited if null.

    • Method Detail

      • setNumberFractionalDigits

        public void setNumberFractionalDigits(int numFracDigits)
        Set number of fractional digits to round sensor values to.

        This class offers rounding as a convenience and because ancestors of this implementation had such a scheme.

        Parameters:
        numFracDigits - if <= 0, no rounding will be performed
